means: 接受(accept的过去式及过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: After a three-weekend courtship, Pamela accepted Randolph's proposal of marriage.
sentence.Network_cn: 经过3个周末的追求之后，帕梅拉接受了伦道夫的求婚。

sentence.Network_en: Fewer than 7% of asylum seekers are accepted as political refugees.
sentence.Network_cn: 寻求避难者中有不到7%的人被视作政治难民。

sentence.Network_en: The Greeks accepted belief in the immortality of the soul.

means.word_mean: 确实的,被批准的,可接受的

entry.tran: 为公众所接受的；公认的
entry.def: Accepted ideas are agreed by most people to be correct or reasonable.

example.ex: There is no generally accepted definition of life...
example.tran: 关于生活的定义不一而足。

example.ex: It is accepted wisdom that science has been partly responsible for the decline of religion.
example.tran: 人们普遍认为，科学的兴起是宗教衰落的部分原因。

sentences.sentence: "several accepted techniques for treating the condition"
"his recognized superiority in this kind of work"

means.word_mean: 2. generally agreed upon; not subject to dispute;
4. judged to be in conformity with approved usage;
6. widely accepted as true or worthy;

sentences.sentence: "Received political wisdom says not; surveys show otherwise"- Economist

auth_sentence.content: Typically, he accepted the blame for the mix-up.
auth_sentence.res_content: Typically, he accepted the blame for the mix-up.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Typically, he accepted the blame for the mix-up.

auth_sentence.content: But this has never been accepted by medical staff.
auth_sentence.res_content: But this has never been accepted by medical staff.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But this has never been accepted by medical staff.

auth_sentence.content: Mr Hardwick said he accepted the judge's decision.

Sentence.sentence: But if he had accepted it, he wouldn't be able to make ends meet.
The creative process has always been accepted as the source of all important work in the arts, but we should not think the creativity plays a role only in the arts.
What is the widely accepted idea about the creative process
Though the Swedish model appears workable for most American parents, it may not be accepted by them in its entirety.
Nearly all application materials are submitted online, and the Common Application provides a one-size-fits form accepted by more than 400 schools, including the nation's most selective.
Not only had she found the highest paying job of her career, but she'd also accepted a date with the most charming men she'd ever met.

means.word_mean: 公认的；为公众所接受的；已被确认的
